layer_sprite_change: Using this function you can change the sprite resource assigned to a given sprite element on a layer. You give the sprite element ID (which you get when you create a sprite element using layer_sprite_create() or when you use the function layer_sprite_get_id()), and then supply a sprite index element asset will be changed. Note that if the sprite has sub-images then it will animate too (this can be controlled using the layer_sprite_index() and layer_sprite_speed() functions). Note that you can assign a value of -1 as the new sprite index and no sprite will be shown, although the element will still exist and can still be changed again later.
The unique ID value of the sprite element to change
The new sprite index to use

{ANY_CODE} var s = layer_sprite_get_id(layer, global.Asset_sprite);
if layer_sprite_get_sprite(s) != spr_Nighttime
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}layer_sprite_change(s, spr_nighttime);
{nbsp_x4}}

The above code checks the sprite index of the element with the ID stored in the global variable <tt>global.Asset_sprite</tt> and if it is not "spr_Nighttime" then that sprite is assigned to the element.
